description: First, second and third floor extensions to existing building to form 2 x 1-bedroom and 4x 2-bedroom residential units with roof garden.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces  of the development, and plans showing their locations, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with style of the building and the surrounding area and the local surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works and manteinance plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved landscaping details and landscaping manteinance plan shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of any unit within the development or in accordance with the phased programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, a plan showing the types, positions, designs and materials of boundary treatment and security fencing to the rear of the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The boundary treatment and security fencing to the rear shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details and fully completed prior to the first occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To ensure that suitable measure to protect the privacy of neighbouring properties are put in place and to ensure that such measures harmonise with style of the building and the surrounding area and the local surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of a ventilation strategy setting out measures for providing fresh air ventilation to the residential units facing the Broadway shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved measures shall be fully installed prior to first occupation of the development and shall be retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure suitable measures are installed to protect residents from air pollution, in accordance with policy 2.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 3: 'Air Quality'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details for mitigation works to protect habitable rooms from external noise shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The criteria to be met and the assessment method used shall be that specified at Ealing's Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration' and Ealing Pollution Control's Document 5.3 'Guidance for Developers'. The mitigation shall also take into account the ventilation strategy for the building approved in accordance with Condition 5 of this permission.  The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the building from noise as the development will be affected by traffic noise at a level which falls into Noise Exposure Category C as defined by PPG24, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to the first occupation of the development, a Refuse Management Plan for the management, storage and collection of refuse from the existing commercial development within the site, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Refuse shall thereafter be managed in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  REASON: To ensure bins are properly managed, stored and collected, in the interests of occupiers of the site and highway safety, in accordance with policies 2.10, 5.5  and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4: 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | The refuse/recycling and cycle storage shown on the approved plan, referenced as SK - 08 rev 8 shall be formed and available for use prior to bringing into first use any of the units hereby permitted and retained permanently thereafter. This area shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area and to provide and retain adequate facilities for cyclists to encourage more sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 2.10, 5.5 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The refuse storage facilities shown on the approved plans, referenced as SK - 08 rev 8 shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To ensure suitable refuse storage and collection facilities are provided prior to occupation in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4: 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | All residential units shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes standards prior to the first occupation of the development, unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure the development provides access for all future occupiers and meets Lifetime Homes Standards in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: 'Accessible Ealing'. | The development hereby approved  shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Secured By Design award before its first occupation, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements in the interests of the safety of the residents and visitors, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and adopted SPG 8: 'Safer Ealing'. | Notwithstanding any indications on the submitted drawings, details of external plant and machinery shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest sensitive facade, during the relevant periods of operation.  REASON: In the interest of the occupiers of these residential properties and nearby residential properties, in accordance with policy 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the information submitted with this application, details of external lighting in association with this development shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority and the details approved shall be completed prior to the first occupation of any of the  residential units hereby permitted.   REASON: In the interest of occupiers of neighbouring properties, community safety and the principles of sustainability in pursuance of policies 4.1, 4.4 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | The development hereby approved shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved plans SK-08 REV 8, SK 09- REV 9, SK-10 REV 6, SK-11 REV 9, SK12 REV 7 received on 27th May 2011, SK-13 received on 5th April 2011 and subsequent amedments to satisfy condition 15; unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   REASON: To ensure the development is built in accordance with approved drawings, in the interest of the visual amenity of the area as a whole and the residential amenity of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 of the adopt ed Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding any information submitted on plans SK-08 REV 8, SK 09 REV 9, a revised layout for the flats fronting onto Broadway shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, the layout approved shall be implemented accordingly.  REASON: In the interest of the occupiers of these residential properties, in accordance with policy 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
